intro: Fimbristylis quinquangularis subsp. macroglumis, commonly known as the broad-leaved spikegrass, is a perennial grass species native to tropical and subtropical regions. It typically grows in wetland habitats, including marshes and seasonally flooded areas. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces spike-like inflorescences with small, clustered flowers. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and a tendency to form dense mats. This subspecies is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support biodiversity.
